details: “J” is the tenth letter in the modern English alphabet. It was one of the last letters to be added and was originally a variant of 'I'. In modern English, it typically represents the sound /dʒ/ as in 'jam'.

wordsData.definition: a container for liquids, with a handle and a spout
wordsData.example: She poured the juice from a large jug.

wordsData.definition: a sweet spread made from fruit and sugar
wordsData.example: He likes toast with strawberry jam.

wordsData.definition: a small, sturdy motor vehicle used for travel over rough ground
wordsData.example: The jeep drove up the rocky hill with ease.

wordsData.definition: a soft, sweet food made by boiling fruit juice with sugar
wordsData.example: She made grape jelly at home.

rhymes.name: J is for Jug (to the tune of 'London Bridge is Falling Down')
content: J is for jug of juicy juice,
J is for jug of juicy juice,

rhymes.name: J is for Jelly (to the tune of 'If You’re Happy and You Know It')
content: Jelly wobbles on my plate, oh what fun!
Jelly wobbles on my plate, see it run!
And it giggles as it giggles!
Jelly wobbles on my plate, yum yum yum!
